Owner of the container table (see next column)

Name of the internal container in which the materialized view data is held. Normally this is the same as MVIEW_NAME. For materialized views created before Oracle8i, Oracle Database attaches the 6-byte prefix SNAP$_. If MVIEW_NAME has more than 19 bytes, then Oracle Database truncates the name to 19 bytes and adds a 4-byte sequence number as a suffix to produce a nonambiguous CONTAINER_NAME.
System change number (SCN) of the last refresh operation
Indicates whether this materialized view includes a GROUP BY clause or aggregation (Y) or not (N)
Approximate refresh time, in seconds, for full refresh
Approximate refresh time, in seconds, for fast refresh
Indicates whether this materialized view contains a view in its definition (Y) or not (N)
Indicates whether this materialized view is UNUSABLE (inconsistent data) (Y) or not (N). A materialized view can be UNUSABLE if a system failure occurs during a full refresh.

Indicates whether this materialized view had a restriction in its defining query that limits the use of query rewrite (Y) or not (N). More complete information is provided by the REWRITE_CAPABILITY column of the *_MVIEWS view.
Indicates whether this materialized view can be fast refreshed (Y) or not (N)
Indicates whether the data contained in the materialized view is known to be inconsistent with the master table data because that has been updated since the last successful refresh (Y) or not (N)
Indicates whether this materialized view is in an invalid state (inconsistent metadata) (Y) or not (N)
Indicates whether this materialized view is currently enabled for query rewrite (Y) or not (N)
SELECT expression of the materialized view definition
